content.title: Primary Lymphedema
content.definition: Lymphedema caused by intrinsic abnormalities of the lymphatic system, typically congenital or hereditary, manifesting as chronic swelling due to impaired lymphatic transport.

congenita.age: Present at birth or within first 2 years

tarda.associations: May be triggered by minor injury or infection

clinical_features.distribution: Usually lower extremities, may involve genitalia
clinical_features.stemmer_sign: Inability to pinch skin at base of second toe

content.statement: Primary Lymphedema is a fundamental concept in Health-Sciences Medicine Surgery Vascular Pathology Lymphatic that provides essential knowledge for understanding related topics and clinical/practical applications.

explanation.technical_details: Technical details involve specific mechanisms, measurements, and evidence-based applications of Primary Lymphedema.

learning_objectives: Classify primary lymphedema by age of onset
clinical_pearls: Praecox is the most common form
